result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

CONDITIONS MODIFIED 09-23-2022:  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness B/Witness C/Eagle's Club listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. 

PREVIOUS CONDITIONS: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle at all. Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS. CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

10:56 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.  Defendant William M Wieland in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for William M Wieland.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes the matter is here on Atty. Wolff's motion to modify bail.  Atty. Wolff presents arguments; he is asking bail be reduced or modified to a signature bond.  State objects and presents arguments.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will grant Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail and modify the cash bail to $7500.00 with the same conditions as previously ordered.  Atty. Wolff is requesting a further proceedings date in about 30 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings before the Branch assigned to the case.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on October 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Matter not called on the record.  Both the Jail and the Sheriff's Department were not aware of this hearing and as a result were not able to get the defendant brought over for court.  Atty. Wolff, who appeared, and the State had no objection to setting the matter over to another date this week before Branch 7 again to address Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail.  Court will adjourn to another date this week for bail hearing.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Motion for Bail Modification, filed by Attorney Wolff.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
2:36 PM Defendant William M Wieland in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $70.00 per month commencing November 1, 2022. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. Court modifies cash bond to include the no contact provisions.  Court sets for status of counsel.
Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
